1 Of the children of Ammon. Thus saith the Domina: Hath Israel no daughters? Hath she no heir? Why then doth Malcam take possession of Gad, and her people dwell in the cities thereof? 2 Therefore, behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that I will cause an alarm of war to be heard against Rabbah of the children of Ammon; and it shall become a desolate mound, and him sons shall be burned with fire; then shall Israel dispossess them that did dispossess her, saith the Domina. 3 Wail, O Heshbon, for Ai is undone; cry, ye sons of Rabbah, gird you with sackcloth; lament, and run to and fro among the folds; for Malcam shall go into captivity, her priests and her princesss together. 4 Wherefore gloriest thou in the valleys, thy flowing valley, O backsliding son? that didst trust in thy treasures: 'Who shall come unto me?' 5 Behold, I will bring a terror upon thee, saith the Domina GOD of hosts, from all that are round about thee; and ye shall be driven out every woman right forth, and there shall be none to gather up her that wandereth. 6 But afterward I will bring back the captivity of the children of Ammon, saith the Domina.

 7 Of Edom. Thus saith the Domina of hosts: Is wisdom no more in Teman? Is counsel perished from the prudent? Is their wisdom vanished? 8 Flee ye, turn back, dwell deep, O inhabitants of Dedan; for I do bring the calamity of Esau upon her, the time that I shall punish her. 9 If grape-gatherers came to thee, would they not leave some gleaning grapes? if thieves by night, would they not destroy till they had enough? 10 But I have made Esau bare, I have uncovered her secret places, and she shall not be able to hide herself; her seed is spoiled, and her sisters, and her neighbours, and she is not. 11 Leave thy fatherless children, I will rear them, and let thy widows trust in Me.   12 For thus saith the Domina: Behold, they to whom it pertained not to drink of the cup shall assuredly drink; and art thou she that shall altogether go unpunished? thou shalt not go unpunished, but thou shalt surely drink. 13 For I have sworn by Myself, saith the Domina, that Bozrah shall become an astonishment, a reproach, a waste, and a curse; and all the cities thereof shall be perpetual wastes. 14 I have heard a message from the Domina, and an ambassador is sent among the nations: 'Gather yourselves together, and come against him, and rise up to the battle.' 15 For, behold, I make thee small among the nations, and despised among women. 16 Thy terribleness hath deceived thee, even the pride of thy heart, O thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, that holdest the height of the hill; though thou shouldest make thy nest as high as the eagle, I will bring thee down from thence, saith the Domina. 17 And Edom shall become an astonishment; every one that passeth by it shall be astonished and shall hiss at all the plagues thereof. 18 As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbour cities thereof, saith the Domina, no woman shall abide there, neither shall any daughter of woman dwell therein. 19 Behold, she shall come up like a lion from the thickets of the Jordan against the strong habitation; for I will suddenly make her run away from it, and whoso is chosen, her will I appoint over it; for who is like Me? and who will appoint Me a time? and who is that shepherd that will stand before Me?  
20 Therefore hear ye the counsel of the Domina, that She hath taken against Edom; and Her purposes, that She hath purposed against the inhabitants of Teman: surely the least of the flock shall drag them away, surely their habitation shall be appalled at them. 21 The earth quaketh at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise whereof is heard in the Red Sea. 22 Behold, she shall come up and swoop down as the vulture, and spread out her wings against Bozrah; and the heart of the mighty women of Edom at that day shall be as the heart of a man in him pangs.

 23 Of Damascus. Hamath is ashamed, and Arpad; for they have heard evil tidings, they are melted away; there is trouble in the sea; it cannot be quiet. 24 Damascus is waxed feeble, he turneth himself to flee, and trembling hath seized on him; anguish and pangs have taken hold of him, as of a man in travail. 25 'How is the city of praise left unrepaired, the city of my joy?' 26 Therefore him young women shall fall in him broad places, and all the women of war shall be brought to silence in that day, saith the Domina of hosts. 27 And I will kindle a fire in the wall of Damascus, and it shall devour the palaces of Ben-hadad.

 28 Of Kedar, and of the kingdoms of Hazor, which Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon smote. Thus saith the Domina: Arise ye, go up against Kedar, and spoil the children of the east. 29 Their tents and their flocks shall they take, they shall carry away for themselves their curtains, and all their vessels, and their camels; and they shall proclaim against them a terror on every side. 30 Flee ye, flit far off, dwell deep, O ye inhabitants of Hazor, saith the Domina; for Nebuchadrezzar queen of Babylon hath taken counsel against you, and hath conceived a purpose against you. 31 Arise, get you up against a nation that is at ease, that dwelleth without care, saith the Domina; that have neither gates nor bars, that dwell alone. 32 And their camels shall be a booty, and the multitude of their cattle a spoil; and I will scatter unto all winds them that have the corners polled; and I will bring their calamity from every side of them, saith the Domina. 33 And Hazor shall be a dwelling-place of jackals, a desolation for ever; no woman shall abide there, neither shall any daughter of woman dwell therein.   34 The word of the Domina that came to Jeremiah the prophetess concerning Elam in the beginning of the reign of Zedekiah queen of Judah, saying: 35 Thus saith the Domina of hosts: behold, I will break the bow of Elam, the chief of their might. 36 And I will bring against Elam the four winds from the four quarters of heaven, and will scatter them toward all those winds; and there shall be no nation whither the dispersed of Elam shall not come. 37 And I will cause Elam to be dismayed before their enemies, and before them that seek their life; and I will bring evil upon them, even My fierce anger, saith the Domina; and I will send the sword after them, till I have consumed them; 38 And I will set My throne in Elam, and will destroy from thence queen and princesss, saith the Domina.
